channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Fibre Internet outage hits some M1 users in western, central and eastern Singapore
item.description:
May 12, 2020 9:34 AM

Apologising for the inconvenience caused, M1 said its engineers are "working hard to resolve the issue".

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on May 12
item.description:
May 12, 2020 7:42 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Tuesday, May 12.

item.title: Repurpose anti-terror tech tools to fight the virus: Security experts
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Technologies for facial recognition, mobile phone tracking, self-screening and automated gantry clearance are not new in countering terrorism. But they can be effective in countering a new enemy that is equally unseen, clandestine and dangerous - Covid-19.

item.title: SafeEntry for cabs: Passengers urged by LTA to scan QR code
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Commuters are being urged to scan the SafeEntry QR code that will be appearing in taxis from today to help facilitate contact tracing in case they are at risk of having been infected with the coronavirus.

item.title: Why OCS training cannot be fully home-based
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Some areas that the Singapore Armed Forces' officer cadets need to be trained in, such as leadership and resilience, cannot be taught via home-based learning.

item.title: Coronavirus: MOH spells out proper use of oxygen level tracking device
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Improper application of pulse oximeters can lead to false readings.

item.title: MP among hundreds down with dengue as peak season starts
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Senior Parliamentary Secretary Low Yen Ling has come down with dengue fever, placing her among the hundreds of people who contracted the disease in recent days as Singapore enters its peak dengue season.

item.title: 3 of the 4 healthcare worker cases at Expo found negative after retesting
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Three of the four Covid-19 cases found among healthcare workers at the Singapore Expo community care facility have been found to be negative after retesting.

item.title: SPH rolls out Tamil Murasu and ST news tablet for bilingual readers
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Readers of the Tamil Murasu newspaper, which is celebrating its 85th anniversary this year, can now choose to read it on a 10.1-inch Samsung tablet.

item.title: Govt to absorb added costs for dorm operators during circuit breaker
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

The Government will be footing the bill for the increased operating costs incurred by dorm operators due to the dormitory lockdowns and stay-home notices imposed on some 300,000 foreign workers across Singapore.

item.title: Sweet treats to bring cheer to 900 ST pocket money fund kids
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Packs of sweet treats are on their way to 900 beneficiaries of The Straits Times School Pocket Money Fund (STSPMF) to boost their spirits during the circuit breaker period.

item.title: Coronavirus: Few flights at Changi Airport but checks stepped up for returnees
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Ground officers now have to clear those arriving in Singapore through a multi-step process.

item.title: Jail, caning for ex-restaurant boss who planned knife attack on rival
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

A former director of Singapore Zam Zam restaurant in North Bridge Road, who masterminded a 2015 attack against a supervisor of rival eatery Victory next door, was sentenced yesterday to six years' jail and six strokes of the cane.

item.title: Man, 68, is 21st death; 486 new cases, with 504 patients discharged
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday announced two deaths - that of a 68-year-old Singaporean man from complications due to Covid-19, and of a 53-year-old Indian man who died of a heart attack.

item.title: Man accused of flouting order to stay home
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

A man who allegedly left his home multiple times although he had been served with a stay-home notice amid the coronavirus outbreak appeared in a district court yesterday.

item.title: 13 firms in S'pore donate hand sanitiser, 100,000 masks to Batam
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Thirteen companies here donated 100,000 KN95 masks and five tonnes of hand sanitiser to Batam, Indonesia, yesterday in an effort organised by Singapore's Economic Development Board (EDB).

item.title: Not true officers visiting homes to enforce circuit breaker rules: Police
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

The police on Sunday dismissed a rumour on social media and text messaging platforms of National Environment Agency and police officers visiting residential units during the Hari Raya period to nab people who flout circuit breaker measures.

item.title: Coronavirus: Efforts to rehouse foreign workers stepped up
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

The former Chancery Court in Dunearn Road has been refurbished to house up to 1,200 healthy foreign workers in essential services.

item.title: DSA exercise begins with selection process going online
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Application for entry to secondary schools and junior colleges next year through the Direct School Admission (DSA) exercise will open from today, with the selection process moving online in the light of the Covid-19 situation.

item.title: 85-year-old among 19 men nabbed in vice raids
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

An 85-year-old man was fined after being caught in a series of police raids that led to the arrest of 30 women for vice-related activity.

item.title: Some businesses gear up for reopening today
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Businesses like hair salons, cake shops and launderettes - part of the group allowed to reopen today as circuit breaker measures are gradually rolled back - were yesterday making final preparations to comply with new safe distancing and contact tracing requirements.

item.title: 3 nabbed as manhunt continues after 19-year-old injured in rioting case
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Three people were arrested on Sunday following a case of rioting at the People's Park Centre apartment block.

item.title: Ikea to open new store at Jem next year
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Swedish retailer Ikea will be expanding to the west of the island and opening its third outlet in Singapore at Jem next year.

item.title: Resident heard murder victim's cries for help
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

A 38-year-old man who sustained multiple stab wounds along Punggol Field on Sunday night has died, in a case classified by police as murder.

item.title: No overseas exercises for SAF officer cadets, but training continues
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Overseas training for trainees at the Singapore Armed Forces' (SAF) Officer Cadet School (OCS) has been cancelled due to the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Businesses ensure safe distancing, contact tracing measures in place
item.description:
May 12, 2020 5:00 AM

Before reopening his hair salon Hairfair today, Mr Augustine Quek spent yesterday afternoon trying to get the QR code for SafeEntry.
